paragraphs.content: Hear ye now what the LORD saith; Arise, contend thou before the mountains, and let the hills hear thy voice.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hear ye now what the Lord saith; Arise, contend thou before the mountains, and let the hills hear thy voice.

paragraphs.content: Hear ye, O mountains, the LORD’s controversy, and ye strong foundations of the earth: for the LORD hath a controversy with his people, and he will plead with Israel.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hear ye, O mountains, the Lord’s controversy, and ye strong foundations of the earth: for the Lord hath a controversy with his people, and he will plead with Israel.

paragraphs.content: O my people, what have I done unto thee? and wherein have I wearied thee? testify against me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O my people, what have I done unto thee? and wherein have I wearied thee? testify against me.

paragraphs.content: For I brought thee up out of the land of Egypt, and redeemed thee out of the house of servants; and I sent before thee Moses, Aaron, and Miriam.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For I brought thee up out of the land of Egypt, and redeemed thee out of the house of servants; and I sent before thee Moses, Aaron, and Miriam.

paragraphs.content: O my people, remember now what Balak king of Moab consulted, and what Balaam the son of Beor answered him from Shittim unto Gilgal; that ye may know the righteousness of the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O my people, remember now what Balak king of Moab consulted, and what Balaam the son of Beor answered him from Shittim unto Gilgal; that ye may know the righteousness of the Lord.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Wherewith shall I come before the LORD, and bow myself before the high God? shall I come before him with burnt offerings, with calves of a year old?
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Wherewith shall I come before the Lord, and bow myself before the high God? shall I come before him with burnt offerings, with calves of a year old?

paragraphs.content: Will the LORD be pleased with thousands of rams, or with ten thousands of rivers of oil? shall I give my firstborn for my transgression, the fruit of my body for the sin of my soul?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Will the Lord be pleased with thousands of rams, or with ten thousands of rivers of oil? shall I give my firstborn for my transgression, the fruit of my body for the sin of my soul?

paragraphs.content: He hath shewed thee, O man, what is good; and what doth the LORD require of thee, but to do justly, and to love mercy, and to walk humbly with thy God?
paragraphs.contentHtml: He hath shewed thee, O man, what is good; and what doth the Lord require of thee, but to do justly, and to love mercy, and to walk humbly with thy God?

paragraphs.content: The LORD’s voice crieth unto the city, and the man of wisdom shall see thy name: hear ye the rod, and who hath appointed it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Lord’s voice crieth unto the city, and the man of wisdom shall see thy name: hear ye the rod, and who hath appointed it.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Are there yet the treasures of wickedness in the house of the wicked, and the scant measure that is abominable?
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Are there yet the treasures of wickedness in the house of the wicked, and the scant measure that is abominable?

paragraphs.content: Shall I count them pure with the wicked balances, and with the bag of deceitful weights?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Shall I count them pure with the wicked balances, and with the bag of deceitful weights?

paragraphs.content: For the rich men thereof are full of violence, and the inhabitants thereof have spoken lies, and their tongue is deceitful in their mouth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the rich men thereof are full of violence, and the inhabitants thereof have spoken lies, and their tongue is deceitful in their mouth.

paragraphs.content: Therefore also will I make thee sick in smiting thee, in making thee desolate because of thy sins.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore also will I make thee sick in smiting thee, in making thee desolate because of thy sins.

paragraphs.content: Thou shalt eat, but not be satisfied; and thy casting down shall be in the midst of thee; and thou shalt take hold, but shalt not deliver; and that which thou deliverest will I give up to the sword.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou shalt eat, but not be satisfied; and thy casting down shall be in the midst of thee; and thou shalt take hold, but shalt not deliver; and that which thou deliverest will I give up to the sword.

paragraphs.content: Thou shalt sow, but thou shalt not reap; thou shalt tread the olives, but thou shalt not anoint thee with oil; and sweet wine, but shalt not drink wine.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou shalt sow, but thou shalt not reap; thou shalt tread the olives, but thou shalt not anoint thee with oil; and sweet wine, but shalt not drink wine.

paragraphs.content: ¶ For the statutes of Omri are kept, and all the works of the house of Ahab, and ye walk in their counsels; that I should make thee a desolation, and the inhabitants thereof an hissing: therefore ye shall bear the reproach of my people.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ For the statutes of Omri are kept, and all the works of the house of Ahab, and ye walk in their counsels; that I should make thee a desolation, and the inhabitants thereof an hissing: therefore ye shall bear the reproach of my people.
